reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed here for 5 nights in August 2012 and found it to be a bright, spacious and immaculately clean hotel and after three days in the Mekong Delta it was a pleasure to return here before heading off to Hanoi. The river view was worth the extra few pounds. We also tried the city view on one return we made, which looks over the pool too and was not unpleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

reviews.text: The hotel is one of the few five stars in the city that has clear attention for Japanese travelers, and there were Japanese tour groups during my stay. The location is a little remote from the city center. Although major attractions are within 10-15 min walk, the route from the back gate will pass some quiet side streets that might not be the best for tourists. It is on the river bank and this might a plus to some if a room with river view is given. Room is average and breakfast is ok, with enough variety of food.

Convenient
reviews.text: The website of this hotel does not do it justice. From our experience it was first class. The lobby is beautiful and often there is a pianist on the piano adding to the classy atmosphere. The Lobby Bar was great for cocktails and relaxing. The buffet breakfast is probably the best I have experienced in my travels. The room was a good size and provided ample room to unpack for a 4 night stay. The locaiton may be off putting for some but there is a pedestarian access gate at the back of the hotel that provides access to all Central Saigon has to offer within a few minutes walk.

The Legend is a business hotel with all the amenities you need, clean room, internet service, ok gym (need newer treadmills), great swimming pool and massage parlor. Ho Chi Minh is a busy city and traffic is one main issue so the location is key. The hotel have a great location with a nice view to the river and is walking distance (2 blocks) from downtown and that is really great when you have some time off. One of the best things of the Legend is the service, everyone is so nice and the food is also awesome. The breakfast buffer is really impressive, one of the best Ive seen. If you can afford the upgrade to the executive floor I strongly recommend it, rooms are very similar but the executive lounge is really something you deserve, drings in the afternoon and breakfast in the morning in a veru quiet 14th floor with a great view.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to walk to all the city attractions from here. If you don't like to walk, taxi rides would be as cheap as chips. We arrived and apparently I'd booked a twin room so they couldnt change the booking to a double bed without charging another $65 per night. The room was fine with a view of the river. We didn't like the buffet breakfast even though it was huge- didn't find the fruit very fresh so went to their cafe the next day. The fine dining restaurant there was expensive and fairly ordinary. The staff however like everywhere in Vietnam were excellent- friendly and more than willing to help with anything. The foyer is beautiful with old world charm
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel well positioned for city touring

reviews.text: Beautiful lobby and room. The room wasn't big, but was very comfortable. Heavy and light robes were provided in the room. We had a river view room-enjoyed watching the boats go by! The staff was excellent and friendly. There are many restaurants within walking distance, as well as a grocery store. Also a shopping mall (Saigon Square). The downside: the included buffet breakfast had many items, most not too tasty to my family. The hallway reeked of cigarette smoke (but no smell at all in our room, thankfully). We didn't go in the pool, but did check it out. It was clean and looked nice.
reviews.title: Hotel is great overall

reviews.text: Had been travelling through Vietnam for the past 2 weeks and was looking forward to the last couple of nights of luxury which they were. I reserved 3 nights and was quoted a per night quote which I accepted over the phone from Hoi An however when i arrived it was the price they quoted PLUS two lots of extra taxes which increased my total bill by nearly $100, now i didn't mind this but was a little disappointed I was not told the EXACT price when I reserved the rooms. Given that I did not stay the full three nights due to flying home and checked out at 6pm on the third night and was not charged the full room rate for such a late check out, so I have to give them credit there. Other than the little expense extra surprise the Legend is amazing, rooms amazing, service in the lounge amazing, pool great and would stay again.
reviews.title: Very nice way to end my trip to Vietnam
